Create and return a CrudColumn object for that column name.

Enables developers to use a fluent syntax to declare their columns, in addition to the existing options:

  • CRUD::addColumn(['name' => 'price', 'type' => 'number']);

field()

Fields.php : 541

Create and return a CrudField object for that field name.

public field(string $name) : CrudField

Enables developers to use a fluent syntax to declare their fields, in addition to the existing options:

  • CRUD::addField(['name' => 'price', 'type' => 'number']);
  • CRUD::field('price')->type('number');

And if the developer uses the CrudField object as Field in their CrudController:

  • Field::name('price')->type('number');
Parameters
$name : string

The name of the column in the db, or model attribute.

filter()

Filters.php : 332

Create and return a CrudFilter object for that attribute.

public filter(string $name) : CrudField

Enables developers to use a fluent syntax to declare their filters, in addition to the existing options:

  • CRUD::addFilter(['name' => 'price', 'type' => 'range'], false, function($value) });
  • CRUD::filter('price')->type('range')->whenActive(function($value) });

And if the developer uses the CrudField object as Field in their CrudController:

  • Filter::name('price')->type('range')->whenActive(function($value) });
Parameters
$name : string

The name of the column in the db, or model attribute.

Return values

getRelationModel()

CrudPanel.php : 349

Get the Eloquent Model name from the given relation definition string.

public getRelationModel(string $relationString[, int $length = null ][, Model $model = null ]) : string
Parameters
$relationString : string

Relation string. A dot notation can be used to chain multiple relations.

$length : int = null

Optionally specify the number of relations to omit from the start of the relation string. If the provided length is negative, then that many relations will be omitted from the end of the relation string.

$model : Model = null

Optionally specify a different model than the one in the crud object.

Tags
example

For a given string 'company' and a relation between App/Models/User and App/Models/Company, defined by a company() method on the user model, the 'App/Models/Company' string will be returned.

example

For a given string 'company.address' and a relation between App/Models/User, App/Models/Company and App/Models/Address defined by a company() method on the user model and an address() method on the company model, the 'App/Models/Address' string will be returned.

Return values
string —

Relation model name.

attachManyRelation()

Create.php : 219

When using the HasMany/MorphMany relations as selectable elements we use this function to "mimic-sync" in those relations.

private attachManyRelation(mixed $item, mixed $relation, mixed $relationDetails, mixed $relationValues) : mixed

Since HasMany/MorphMany does not have the sync method, we manually re-create it. Here we add the entries that developer added and remove the ones that are not in the list. This removal process happens with the following rules:

  • by default Backpack will behave like a sync from M-M relations: it deletes previous entries and add only the current ones.
  • force_delete is configurable in the field, it's true by default. When false, if connecting column is nullable instead of deleting the row we set the column to null.
  • fallback_id could be provided. In this case instead of deleting we set the connecting key to whatever developer gives us.
Parameters
$item : mixed
$relation : mixed
$relationDetails : mixed
$relationValues : mixed
Return values
mixed —

createUpdateOrDeleteOneToOneRelation()

Create.php : 173

Save the attributes of a given HasOne or MorphOne relationship on the related entry, create or delete it, depending on what was sent in the form.

private createUpdateOrDeleteOneToOneRelation(HasOne|MorphOne $relation, string $relationMethod, array<string|int, mixed> $relationDetails) : Model|null

For HasOne and MorphOne relationships, the dev might want to a few different things: (A) save an attribute on the related entry (eg. passport.number) (B) set an attribute on the related entry to NULL (eg. slug.slug) (C) save an entire related entry (eg. passport) (D) delete the entire related entry (eg. passport)

getRelationDetailsFromInput()

Input.php : 80

Get a relation data array from the form data. For each relation defined in the fields through the entity attribute, and set some relation details.

private getRelationDetailsFromInput(array<string|int, mixed> $input[, array<string|int, mixed> $crudFields = [] ][, mixed $relationMethod = false ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

We traverse this relation array later to create the relations, for example:

  • Current model HasOne Address
  • Address (line_1, country_id) BelongsTo Country through country_id in Address Model

So when editing current model crud user have two fields

  • address.line_1
  • address.country (we infer country_id from relation)

Those will be nested accordingly in this relation array, so address relation will have a nested relation with country.

Parameters

The form input.

$crudFields : array<string|int, mixed> = []
  • present when getting the relation details for other relations.
$relationMethod : mixed = false
Return values

modelMethodIsRelationship()

Relationships.php : 331

Checks the properties of the provided method to better verify if it could be a relation.

private modelMethodIsRelationship( $model,  $method) : bool|string

Case the method is not public, is not a relation. Case the return type is Attribute, or extends Attribute is not a relation method. If the return type extends the Relation class is for sure a relation Otherwise we just assume it's a relation.

DEV NOTE: In future versions we will return false when no return type is set and make the return type mandatory for relationships. This function should be refactored to only check if $returnType is a subclass of Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Relations\Relation.

$model :
$method :
Return values
